titleStmt.title: Edward Humphrey to James F. Robinson
CWG8994

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his Excellency James F Robinson Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner Edward Humpries states that he was indicted and at the present term of the ^Hancock^ Han^co^k Circuit Court found guilty of the offence of selling liquor to William Herron Jr a minor under the age of 21 years son of William Herron -- that neither the father nor son could write but before the selling refered to in the Indictment at the father of the man or directed an older brother of the minor to write an order to your petitioner authorizing him to sell to the minor any liquor he might wish to drink -- this writing was made and delivered to your and was produced in court but the minor stated that he could neither write nor read writing and although a writing to that efect had been delivered to petitioner, he could not say the one produced in court was the Identical same writing authorized by his father -- the father & Eder son who wrote the authorization had since become non residents of the state of Ky and then endorsed could not be processed. The court therefore refused allow the paper to go to the jury and ^he^ was consequently found guilty. He makes copy of the Indictment and Judgment part hereof -- He prays that the fine be remitted

Subscribed & sworn to before me by Edward Humphrey the 12 August 1863 --
Geo W Tully D C H C C

The undersigned are the Jury who tried the case of the Commonwealth agt Edward Humphrey and state the foregoing petition is a fair statement of the trial and and conviction They respectfully unite in the petition that said fine be remitted

Henry E Haynes
William Newman
James M. Connell
John A. Clark
Joseph Greathouse
F S. Grayham
G. C. P. Baker
R Purcell
Wm Temple

E Humphrey
To } Petition
Governor
Hancock Cir. Ct
$50. } liquor to a minor
Issd Aug 18. 1863
Fine remitted except Ten dollars & the costs
